description:
Usually offered as a survey of philosophic and political ideas, artistic conventions, and texts from 1690 to 1800. Typical readings might be in Swift, Pope, Gay, Boswell, Johnson, Burke, Gibbon, Chatterton, and Blake. The course has also been offered in recent years as a close study of a particular theme or problem in the 18th Century, such as taht of seduction. 

See the English Department's website at www.english.upenn.edu for a complete description of the current offerings.
name: Samuel Johnson and His Circle
